name: ScaleChain.io
body:
### Problem
The number of Bitcoin transactions are [growing over time](https://blockchain.info/charts/n-transactions?timespan=all), but Bitcoin full nodes require to keep all transactions from genesis block. The size of blockchain is also [growing over time](https://blockchain.info/charts/blocks-size?timespan=all). Increasing block size of Bitcoin is not an ultimate solution to this problem, as Bitcoin core still needs to keep all transactions data in a single node.

### ScaleChain.io
ScaleChain.io focuses on solving the scalability issue of Bitcoin's blockchain. 
There are three ways to solve this issue.

1. Reduce database size for a node.  
2. Reduce the transactions on blocks using side chains, and off-chain transactions.

### About Kangmo Kim 
Kangmo Kim is founder of ScaleChain.io. He started software development since 1988. After developing in-memory SQL database, Altibase for five years, he worked at Microsoft China for 2.5 years. After then he led a team to develop the first version of low latency( < 70us for order execution ) stock exchange in Korea Exchange, and built teams in [Korbit](http://korbit.co.kr), the first Bitcoin exchange in Korea as CTO. He believes that cryptocurrencies will change the way people spend, save and invest money in near future. 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/kangmo

### Forum
[Bitcoin Scalability](https://groups.google.com/d/forum/bitcoin-scalability) forum is for the discussion on the scalability issues of Bitcoin.
